title.narrative: Green Cities initiative (GCI): building back better for climate and resilient sustainable transiti

description.narrative: The FAO Director General has identified GCI as a priority area with a target of involving 1000 cities by 2030. In this regards FAO has created the Green Cities Action Programme: building back better to support the realization of the target. This FMM sub-theme directly contributes to this programme developing key products and tools to allow stakeholders to develop their own GCI initiatives. The sub-programme follows the approach of green recovery, building back better and ensuring a long-term sustainable transition under climate change in relation to food, energy, green jobs, living and wellbeing. The sub-programme will improve the livelihoods and well-being of urban and peri-urban populations in at least 100 cities and around the world over the next three years, this will contribute to the overall aim of reaching 1000 cities by 2030. This will be achieved by generating new data and establishing systems and partnerships for knowledge sharing and dissemination; and by raising awareness among decision-makers and the general public in target cities on the substantive contribution that greener cities and stronger urban and peri-urban agri-food systems can make in terms of inclusive economic growth, food and nutrition security. The ultimate impact of the project will be improving the health, diets and well-being of urban and peri-urban populations are increased through improved access to products and services provided by urban and peri-urban forests, agriculture and food systems which contribute to a green recovery, is climate resilient and has reduced environmental impacts, including lower GHG emissions per capita.
